Workplace Solutions Consultant

Company Name Victorian Chamber of Commerce and Industry Company Location Level 3 150 Collins Street, Melbourne, VIC 3000, AU

Posted Date Posted 1 day ago Number of views 14 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

  • Identify business opportunities to deliver a wide range of off the shelf training and bespoke training and consulting services to the Victorian business community
  • Great career opportunity to work across multiple business units that play a key role in driving Victorian business forward

About the role
This is an exciting opportunity for a highly motivated and hands-on salesperson to play a key part within our Workplace Solutions team by identifying, progressing and ultimately closing opportunities to deliver off the shelf and bespoke training and consulting services. Supervising a small team, you will assume responsibility for generating new business and following up on leads provided to you from our existing member and client base, preparing proposals and ultimately closing those opportunities. To be successful you will have demonstrated capability in leading and coaching a small team to achieve targets, you will build strong internal networks, working collaboratively with consultants and staff from other business units to obtain relevant information relating to client queries and ensuring you are providing the best possible service and offerings to our clients’ needs. You will work efficiently and systematically to follow up on sales leads to close opportunities to meet our team’s sales and revenue targets.

About you
This role would suit someone who has strong business acumen and enjoys interacting with clients to understand their needs and find ways to meet them with our wide range of training and consulting products. In addition you will:

• Be organised and have a passion for delivering exceptional customer service
• Thrive on achieving sales targets and can demonstrate successful achievement of your KPIs
• Have the ability to quickly and accurately draft proposals (from a wide range of templates and previous
proposals) outlining our offer to clients
• Possess exceptional verbal and written communication skills
• Previous experience or capacity in leading a small team to achieve targets

Training will be provided to ensure familiarity with our products and consultants. You will have the added benefit of professional development by participating in our training courses in topics such as Leadership and Management, Equal Opportunity and Health, Safety and Wellbeing to assist you in closing opportunities.

Be part of a dynamic and forward thinking organisation that not only drives economic change and prosperity, but offers a healthy and collaborative working environment. A competitive salary, along with a range of employee benefits will be offered to the successful candidate.


How to apply
If this sounds like you, please apply online under the Careers section of our website, through our talent community, LiveHire, www.victorianchamber.com.au/careers by 9am Monday 17 September 2018. Applications, including a cover letter briefly addressing the Key Selection Criteria contained within the position description, should be addressed to Jane McKay. The position description can be found under the Careers section of our website.
Please note that the successful applicant will be subject to a satisfactory police check as a pre-condition of employment. Applicants must also hold a valid driver’s licence.

844104813:
[

Experience Designer | VIC

Company Name Readify Company Location Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 2 weeks ago Number of views 154 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

About Us


Consultants at Readify are known for discovering the latest and greatest in technologies, mastering their nuances, and influencing our clients and our community with their potential.


Currently, we're expanding our capability to delivery high quality UX end to end. We're working with Tier 1 clients to define the right problems to solve, and deliver solid UX and usability in agile teams. Our Design practice draws on the fundamentals, including qualitative research, personas, rapid prototyping, wireframing/storyboarding and usability testing. We analyse usage data and traffic patterns and employ an agile mindset, beyond the rituals. We're software-agnostic (but have found success with Sketch, Photoshop, InVision, and the irreplaceable Sharpie).


About You


We're looking for someone who is self-driven, curious and able to solve complex problems.


Ideally, you:


  • Know the difference between UX and UI
  • Have experience working in an Agile environment
  • Are a strong influencer and take a consultative approach to dealing with clients
  • Can lead a discovery engagement to uncover and define the right problems to solve
  • Can lead a team to solve problems in:
    • The User Experience
    • The Client's Business
    • The Design Process itself


You may have some experience with Business Model design/Lean Canvas, product management/strategy, and/or story mapping.


Why Readify?


We're a Microsoft Gold Partner, and are a subsidiary of Telstra. This means you'll enjoy a greater variety of challenging projects, the opportunity to work alongside some of the smartest people in the country, and access to a range of Readify and Telstra perks. We also invest heavily in our people, offering substantial Toolkit Allowances and paid professional development. You'll be part of a community where continuous learning and improvement isn’t just enabled, but expected.


If you like the sound of us, hit apply! We'd love to learn more about you.

Seniority Level

Mid-Senior level

Industry

  • Information Technology and Services

Employment Type

Full-time

Job Functions

  • Consulting
  • Design

Job description

Are you a juggling superstar?

Do you have that personality that people can't help but be drawn to?

Do you have the drive to expand your skill set and hit the ground running in a fast-growing company?
\xa0

Join one of Melbourne's fast growing digital agencies, specialising in conversion rate optimisation and user testing. Experience the hustle and bustle of agency life, and gain valuable experience in multiple industries.\xa0


Our team enjoys beautiful office in the centre of Prahran, pizza Friday and monthly team bonding activities. Our agency are big advocates of work-life balance, and are seeking a team member who want to love their job!


We are looking for a team player who loves to add value to clients, whilst also understanding the restrictions of commerciality. A senior position with room for growth, you will own a portfolio of diverse clients across multiple industries – both retainer and project based – and deliver web and mobile solutions across the portfolio.\xa0


We are searching for an account manager that has experience juggling multiple clients and projects, with experience in the digital arena.


You will be happy to take ownership of your accounts, and always strive to not only exceed expectations, but to help grow these accounts. You will be pro-active in understanding your client's business intimately, developing and maintaining strong relationships, critically assess the strategies set in place and adhering to strict deadlines/budgets. Working with the head of accounts and the technical lead, you will plan and deliver client work in a timely manner.
\xa0

As our new digital account executive, you will:

  • Be degree qualified (business/marketing would be a bonus)
  • Have experience in the digital arena management (SEO, SEM, Email Marketing, Social Media, Website development)
  • Strong relationship/project management skills
  • +1 years experience in account management beneficial
  • Strong communication skills – fluency in English is a must!
  • Ability to work autonomously
  • Not let stress get the better of you
  • Have Exceptional organisation skills
  • Have the right to work in Australia
    \xa0

Does this sound like you? Want to work with people who don't take themselves too seriously, but just get the job done? If so, please send your CV and cover letter.

Sales Analyst

Posted Date Posted 2 days ago Number of views 44 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

  • Attractive remuneration package + yearly bonus incentive
  • Supportive team & Management
  • Career development & learning opportunities
  • Immediate start required!

About the role


 Great opportunity for a driven and enthusiastic Sales Analyst\xa0to join our Port Melbourne team! Reporting to the Commercial Director of Assurance, you will be responsible for the collection, analysis and reporting of sales related data and administration. The successful candidate will identify key opportunities or potential issues to a number of teams across our business.



Key Responsibilities

  • Prepare high level sales reports that will assist with sales trends and forecasting and facilitate our Sales teams in driving sales and meeting targets
  • Provide a high level of administrative support to ensure our major accounts run smoothly through identifying problems, analysing information and developing solutions


About you


We are looking for someone who is analytic, ambitious and driven! This is a great development opportunity if you’re wanting to get into Commercial or Business analysis as it comes with lots of exposure to a number of different teams and projects across our business!


  • You will be personable, confident and positive! Your strong people skills allow you to move seamlessly between dealing with top executives down to more junior staff across a number of sectors \xa0

  • You will have high analytic skills, with a passion for processing data and the ability to draw meaningful business insights as a result

  • \xa0You will possess strong customer service skills and administrative experience including advanced skills in MS Word and Excel

  • You will be insightful and have the ability to build strong relationships in order to drive efficiency


Selection Criteria

\xa0

  • 3+ years’ experience in a similar analytical position; compiling and manipulating data, assessing trends, forecasting and framing decisions (essential)
  • Tertiary Qualifications in Business/Commerce or a related field
  • \xa0Administrative experience with exceptional interpersonal and written communication skills
  • Demonstrated experience liaising with multiple stakeholders and business units (internal/external)
  • Advanced MS Excel skills

Next Steps?

To take advantage of this opportunity click 'Apply'\xa0or for further information email recruitment@saiglobal.com

SAI Global is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to creating an environment that celebrates diversity and embraces differences. We have a culture that supports family friendly practices, flexible work arrangements and all our offices are disability accessible.

Credit Analysts | Melbourne

Company Name Macquarie Group Company Location Melbourne, AU

Posted Date Posted 1 day ago Number of views 61 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

A number of exciting opportunities are currently available that will enable you to build and nurture strong relationships with third party introducers and internal stakeholders. As a key member of the team you will be responsible for assessing and decisioning new consumer finance applications under a credit approval authority. Additionally, there will be some opportunity to assess chattel mortgage, novated leasing and equipment finance applications.

Using your exceptional communication skills and ability to explain credit decisions you will provide outstanding and professional customer service to our introducers, including motor vehicle dealerships, brokers and aggregator firms, and other internal and external introducers.

A thorough understanding of commercial lending practices or leasing practices will be highly valued, together with exceptional detail orientation and a proven ability to meet deadlines, prioritise and perform a wide variety of tasks throughout the day. Using your working knowledge of credit, and a solid understanding of compliance related issues, you will oversee risk oversight, ensuring credit policy is maintained and applied and ultimately, that appropriate credit decisions are taken.

To be successful in this role, you will have previous experience as a credit analyst, preferably within the Asset Finance industry. You will possess strong financial analysis skills and be confident to manage relationships and make commercially sound decisions.

We are based in Sydney and Melbourne, we are flexible as to specific working arrangements for the right applicants - full time or part time, Mon-Fri rosters through to rosters including weekends, early or late shifts – are all available options.

If you possess the relevant skills and experience, submit your application via the 'apply' link. If you may require additional information, please contact Melissa Liekens at melissa.liekens@macquarie.com

With Offices In Australia, New Zealand, Asia, North America And Europe, Corporate And Asset Finance Specialises In

Macquarie’s Corporate and Asset Finance Group provides innovative and traditional capital, finance and related services to clients operating in selected international markets.
  • leasing and asset finance,
